com.barrysheehan.www

Interface TextSwapper

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TextSimplifier

    public interface TextSwapper
    Defines methods used to swap words from a body of text with any words of the programmer's choosing.

    A String of text is passed to a class implementing TextSwapper. It tests each word against criteria defined by the programmer and returns a new text with the appropriate words swapped with a predefined word or words.

    Since:
    1.8
    See Also:
    TextSimplifier

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String swapText(java.lang.String text)
      Reads a supplied String of text and returns the same text with appropriate words changed to match a word or words predefined in the program.
      java.lang.String swapWord(java.lang.String word)
      Swaps a word provided to it with another predefined word
      boolean testWord(java.lang.String word)
      Tests a word passed to it against criteria defined by the programmer, returning a boolean value based on the success of the test.

    • Method Detail

      • swapText

        java.lang.String swapText(java.lang.String text)
        Reads a supplied String of text and returns the same text with appropriate words changed to match a word or words predefined in the program.
        Parameters:
        text - text to be read, tested and swapped
        Returns:
        text with the appropriate words swapped

      • testWord

        boolean testWord(java.lang.String word)
        Tests a word passed to it against criteria defined by the programmer, returning a boolean value based on the success of the test.
        Parameters:
        word - a word to to test
        Returns:
        true or false depending on whether testing criteria are met

      • swapWord

        java.lang.String swapWord(java.lang.String word)
        Swaps a word provided to it with another predefined word
        Parameters:
        word - word to be swapped with a predefined word
        Returns:
        the predefined word
